qas.question: What what was the name of the subsidiary working in Germany during World War 2?
Records for how many people were maintained by IBM in 1937?
What service did IBM provide for the Nuremberg Trials?
What year did IBM open its first office in Bahrain?
What was the eventual name of the company that IBM operated in Saudi Arabia?
What did Bahrain's tabulating equipment help organizations process?
How many people were employed by the Third Reich?

plausible_answers.text: M1 Carbine, and Browning Automatic Rifle

qas.question: What two types of weapons were used by the Third Reich in 1937?
In what year did the Nuremburg Trials begin?
In what year did the German subsidiary Dehomag open for business?

context: In <b8_0>1937<b8_0/>, IBM's tabulating equipment enabled organizations to process <b5_0>unprecedented amounts of data<b5_0/>, its clients including the U.S. Government, during its first effort to maintain the employment records for <a1_0><b6_0>26 million<b6_0/><a1_0/> people pursuant to the Social Security Act, and the Third Reich, largely through the German subsidiary <a0_0>Dehomag<a0_0/>. During the Second World War the company produced small arms for the American war effort (<b7_0>M1 Carbine, and Browning Automatic Rifle<b7_0/>). IBM provided <a2_0>translation services<a2_0/> for the Nuremberg Trials. In <a3_0><b9_0>1947<b9_0/><a3_0/>, IBM opened its first office in Bahrain, as well as an office in Saudi Arabia to service the needs of the Arabian-American Oil Company that would grow to become <a4_0>Saudi Business Machines<a4_0/> (SBM).
